newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Brewer Grolsch says not in takeover talks.
newsitem.headline: Brewer Grolsch says not in takeover talks.

text.p: Dutch brewer Grolsch said on Tuesday it was not currently in talks about a takeover of its business and had no plans to start such discussions soon.
There have been persistent market rumours in Amsterdam in recent days that Grolsch is a likely bid target.
"We are not speaking with anybody on this subject at the moment, and don't intend to do so in the near future either," Grolsch spokesman Cees Dubbeldam said.
A series of potential interested parties have been touted in the market, dealers said, including Belgium's Interbrew, Heineken NV, the UK's Bass Plc and Anheuser-Busch of the U.S..
Speculation about a possible takeover of Grolsch resurfaced when its chairman Paul Snoep last month unexpectedly announced his intention to step down after ten years in the post.

Grolsch posted disappointing 1996 results in March and presented a gloomy outlook for the current year, sending its shares tumbling nearly 20 percent. The stock has since recovered some ground in the buoyant Amsterdam market.
Grolsch's share price was little changed on Tuesday, trading down 10 cents at 68 guilders in modest volume.
